title: Combustion: Fire Explained
description: A short lesson to help you apply Combustion: Fire Explained.

hook.text: Fire isn't a thing. It's a chemical reaction â€” fuel combining rapidly with oxygen.

buildup.text: Combustion needs three things: fuel, oxygen, and heat. Remove any one and fire dies.

discovery.text: The heat breaks chemical bonds in fuel. Atoms recombine with oxygen, releasing more heat.

twist.text: A candle flame is a zone of continuous chemical reactions â€” not a solid object.

climax.text: In zero gravity, flames are spherical because there's no convection to shape them.

punchline.text: Fire is chemistry you can see. It's just atoms swapping partners very enthusiastically.

quiz.question: What three things does fire need to burn?
